Result.Abstract: At the dawn of the 21st century, educational research is finally entering the 20th century. Result.Abstract: Embedded multimedia refers to teaching methods that embed video content within teachers' lessons. The research of Mayer and others has suggested that multimedia instruction can enhance learning by using the capacity of both visual and verbal memory systems. Result.Title: Achievement Effects of Embedded Multimedia in a Success for All Reading Program

Result.Abstract: A variety of silicotic lesions derived from thoracic silicosis via lymphohematogenous spread to the liver, spleen, bone marrow, and extrathoracic lymph nodes are described. The morphologic features of these lesions depend on the extent of macrophage aggregation, the occurrence of fibrogenesis, and the development of necrosis and degradative changes in macrophages and adjacent extracellular matrix, presumably caused by lysosomal enzymes
Result.Title: Extrapulmonary silicosis: a clinical, morphologic, and ultrastructural study

Result.Abstract: This article systematically reviews research on elementary reading programs for English language learners and other language-minority students.
